thread.title: Getac to showcase complete rugged computing capability at DSEI
thread.title_full: Getac to showcase complete rugged computing capability at DSEI

author: Retail Technology Review
title: Getac to showcase complete rugged computing capability at DSEI
text:
Send to friend 
Getac, the global designer and manufacturer of rugged mobile computers, will showcase its complete range of fully rugged mobile computer solutions and partnership capabilities for the Defence sector at DSEI. 
These include the new F110 Secure, a fully rugged 11.6" Windows tablet with integrated hardware encryption capability from ViaSat, the X500 Fully Rugged Mobile Server, a 15.6" notebook offering up to 6TB of storage and the 8" T800 thin and light fully rugged mobile tablet. 
Joining Getac will be Centerprise International, which has been providing solutions and services to the MOD for over thirty years and Serbus, which will showcase Criptify, its secure, defence communication solution for calls and messages. 
Also on the stand will be Helyx with its Geospatial Information Systems (GIS), Becrypt, demonstrating its Windows and Android software encryption solutions, and CRFS, the world's leading supplier of distributed RF spectrum intelligence systems. 
Peter Molyneux, President, Getac UK, says: "At DSEI this year we are again proud to demonstrate our fully rugged notebook and tablet products integrated into our partners' value added solutions and services. As always DSEI is expected to be a very busy event and we look forward to meeting current and new customers." 
Getac will be exhibiting at Stand S9-207 at DSEI at Excel London from September 15-18 and supplies militaries across the globe, including the UK Ministry of Defence and the US Army.
